Vitalik's Trustless Manifesto demands zero trust assumptions

Automata's Proof of Build removes blind trust from software builds with verifiable provenance onchain ‚úß

Supported by @boundless_xyz, @SuccinctLabs, and @brevis_zk

trustlessbuilds (dot) xyz 
Trustless software can only be achieved if we bridge the gap between:

‚ñ∂Ô∏é readable source code on GitHub
‚ñ∂Ô∏é executable code on @ethereum

Web3 relies on social assumptions that the deployed binary is exactly the same as the source code, but it leads to supply-chain risks.
The industry standard for software provenance uses an SLSA provenance file packaged inside a Sigstore bundle.

Verifying that onchain is computationally expensive, so Proof of Build generates lightweight proofs with zkVM guest programs that make validation practical. 
Automata's Proof of Build provides cryptographic proof onchain that an artifact was built from an exact git commit by an expected builder.

Read:

https://blog.ata.network/proof-of-build-verifiable-software-provenance-onchain-e05bba48bc6d
